level.heading: Competitive energy supplier consumer awareness program.

level.text: The Office of the People's Counsel shall establish a program to increase the awareness of District residents of the availability of services offered by competitive energy providers and the means by which to procure such services.

The Public Service Commission shall establish a program to increase the awareness of District residents of the availability of services offered by competitive energy providers and the means by which to procure such services.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: Law 17-219, the "Fiscal Year 2009 Budget Support Act of 2008", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-678, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 13, 2008, and June 3, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 26, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-419 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-219 became effective on August 16, 2008.

level.heading: Miscellaneous Notes
level.text: Short title: Section 2025 of D.C. Law 17-219 provided that subtitle K of title II of the act may be cited as the "Competitive Energy Supplier Consumer Awareness Amendment Act of 2008".
